III- Television’s contribution to classroom presentation
A. Graphic resources
B. Human resources (on-screen teacher, content specialists,
production staff)
C. Technical resources
Do Availability of lesson to many classrooms
IV• Classroom contributions to the television lesson
(Points Utilization of television lesson is a
cooperative process with no passive roles.)
A- Preparation
1. General preparation for television in the classroom
a. Classroom teacher's preparation
(1) Mastery of elements and techniques of good
teaching (college or university training,
in-service training, experience in teaching)
(2) Insights gained in day-to-day experience with
a particular class
b. Students’ preparation
(1) Orientation to learning from television
(2) Acceptance of television’s characteristics
and conventions
2. Preparation for television in a particular school
situation
a. Decision making (with reference to placing
television in the classroom)
b. Selecting the lesson or lessons
(1) Ultimate basis: what television can do for
the learner
